ongoing.name: AI Safety Fundamentals
ongoing.description: A comprehensive introduction to AI safety concepts and alignment research. This course covers core alignment theory, AI governance, and technical safety approaches.
ongoing.registrationInfo: Registration for the current cohort is closed. The next cohort will begin in September 2025.

ongoing.name: Technical AI Safety Research
ongoing.description: An advanced course on technical AI safety research. Students will learn about current research directions in AI alignment and work on practical projects implementing safety techniques.
ongoing.registrationInfo: Open to UBC graduate students in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, and related fields.

ongoing.name: AI Alignment Reading Group
ongoing.description: A community-led reading group focused on AI alignment research papers and concepts. We discuss recent advances in AI safety research and their implications.
ongoing.registrationInfo: Open to anyone interested in AI safety. We meet every other Tuesday at the London EA Hub.

upcoming.name: AI Safety Summer School
upcoming.description: A month-long intensive summer school focused on AI safety and alignment. Students will learn from leading researchers and work on collaborative projects.
upcoming.registrationInfo: Applications open March 15, 2025. Open to international students with backgrounds in computer science, mathematics, or philosophy.

upcoming.name: Applied AI Safety
upcoming.description: A hands-on course focusing on practical implementation of AI safety techniques. Participants will learn to implement safety methods in modern ML systems.
upcoming.registrationInfo: Applications open June 2025. Participants should have prior experience with machine learning and programming.

upcoming.name: Governance & AI Safety
upcoming.description: An interdisciplinary course examining the governance, policy, and institutional aspects of ensuring the safe development of advanced AI systems.
upcoming.registrationInfo: Registration opens July 2025. The course is open to graduate students and professionals in relevant fields.
